intro: Bunium subcarneum, commonly known as the fleshy bugloss, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Bunium subcarneum is typically found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its fleshy, succulent leaves are a distinguishing feature, contributing to its common name.
